stem: The emergency department nurse is triaging victims from an industrial explosion. Based on the documented physical findings for each victim, assign the most appropriate START triage tag.

tabs.title: Incident Overview
tabs.content:
10:00: Natural gas explosion reported at a local manufacturing plant. Multiple casualties reported. 
10:15: Triage area established in the plant parking lot. Victims are being categorized before transport to Level 1 trauma centers. 
10:30: Initial count: 6 dead, 12 critical, 25 ambulatory.

tabs.title: Victim Assessments
tabs.content:
VictimRespirationsPerfusion (Pulse/CR)Mental Status
Victim A24/minWeak radial pulse; CR 4.5sObedient but lethargic
Victim B34/minRapid radial pulse; CR 1.5sAnxious, follows commands
Victim C14/minStrong radial pulse; CR 1.8sAlert; walking and helping others
Victim DNoneNo pulses; pupils fixed/dilatedUnresponsive

tabs.title: Injury Findings
tabs.content:
Victim A: Spurting arterial blood from right thigh. 
Victim B: 30% partial-thickness burns to chest and back. 
Victim C: Minor lacerations to bilateral forearms. 
Victim D: Full-thickness burns over 90% of body; unresponsive to pain.

rows.text: Victim A: CR 4.5s, Arterial bleed, Lethargic
Victim B: RR 34, Anxious, follows commands
Victim C: RR 14, Walking and alert
Victim D: No respirations, No pulses, 90% burns

rationale.correct: Victim A is **Red** because the capillary refill is > 2s (Failed Perfusion). Victim B is also **Red** because the RR is > 30 (Failed Respirations). Victim C is **Green** because they are ambulatory ('walking wounded'). Victim D is **Black** because they are non-breathing and non-responsive.
clinicalPearls: If a victim fails ANY part of RPM (Respirations >30, Perfusion/CR >2s, Mental Status/Commands), they are RED.
Triage is dynamic; a Green victim can quickly become Red as they go into shock.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking that a walking person with a 'broken arm' might be Yellow.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: If they can walk themselves to the triage area, they are ALWAYS Green initially.
